intro: Miconia neei, commonly known as the Neei miconia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Melastomataceae. It is native to the tropical regions of Central and South America, particularly in the Amazon rainforest. The plant is characterized by its large, glossy, dark green leaves and clusters of small, white to pinkish flowers. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in lowland forests. Miconia neei is noted for its ecological importance, providing food and habitat for various insect and bird species.
